item.title: The #OpenStreetMap Belgium Mapper of the Month #MotM series flies to USA to let us meet Patricia Solis known for her involvement in #YouthMappers: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/11/01/patricia-solis.html
Let‚Äôs meet Jonathan Czalaj, the #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/10/22/jonathan-czalaj.html
A no less than 2h video of using #EveryDoor to contribute to #OpenStreetMap by no less than the author of the app himself: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=qnDqJJ0Z7jU
Always nice to red practical experience from the field to contribute to #OpenStreetMap. With #EveryDoor, this time: https://www.openstreetmap.org/
@zverik Version 2.0 of #EveryDoor is available. And the ‚ÄúHow to use Every Door‚Äù article explains the spirit of the tool: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Zverik/diary/399947 #OpenStreetMap
#Imagico shares his ‚ÄúThoughts on the #OpenStreetMap data model‚Äù. A long read but good food for thoughts. http://blog.imagico.de/thoughts-on-the-openstreetmap-data-model/
Useful plugins in #JOSM to ease your mapping. #OpenStreetMap https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/jmsbert/diary/399865

@zverik released v1.0 of the #EveryDoor app (for Android and iOS) to edit #OpenStreetMap on the go. Presented by the author as ‚ÄúThe best mobile editor for adding shops and amenities to OpenStreetMap.‚Äù Give it a try and let know what you find of it. üòÉ https://github.com/Zverik/every_door Via #WeeklyOSM: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/15885

@mvexel created a tool to let you ‚ÄúMeet Your Mappers‚Äù, i.e. discover #OpenStreetMap mappers near you (or anywhere else, in fact). Website: https://mym.rtijn.org/ Demo video: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1570683649

Powered by #Wikidata, #OpenStreetMap, and other sources, the ‚ÄúNotable People Map‚Äù is showing birthplace of the most "notable people" around the world. Data has been processed to show only one person for each unique geographic location with the highest notability rack. https://tjukanovt.github.io/notable-people If you wondered how someone qualifies for the notability criteria, there is an article about that: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-022-01369-4.
For this issue of #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM, let‚Äôs head to Italy to meet Domenico Calvagna: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/08/01/domenico-calvagna.html.

Jean Marco Rojas, a student at Instituto Tecnol√≥gico de Costa Rica, is running a survey to evaluate a possible new feature to #OSMTracker to upload traces to custom repositories and not only to #OpenStreetMap so that a mapping team will be able to manage their traces, for different purposes and later, if they consider it, upload them to OSM. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2JwrO8DczboSxewel3KIiafDDOpnfzd6VHhUtL-wTlv7KTg/viewform

Elements of a #Map. There are eight key elements that should be included each time a map is created in order to aid the viewer. If north arrow and scale bar pop to mind, you‚Äôd be right. What are the other six? https://www.gislounge.com/whats-in-a-map/
#OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM goes back home to let us get to know Ivan Lievens from Belgium: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/07/01/ivan-lievens.html.

The OpenCage Blog interview series with #OpenStreetMap communities around the world is with Martijn van Exel @mvexel this time to hear all about OpenStreetMap in Utah: https://blog.opencagedata.com/post/openstreetmap-in-utah.
#OBS Project is looking to learn more about how you use OBS. As OBS Studio does not collect any telemetry, they‚Äôre reliant on users‚Äô direct feedback: https://obsproject.com/survey.

Osm Go! is looking for translators and developers. Osm Go! is a Android application and a Progressive Web Applications for contributing to #OpenStreetMap. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Binnette/diary/399389 #osmgo
Where are the 10 closest airports near any point on the map? This fun web app gives the visual answer, powered by #OpenStreetMap data. https://willymaps.github.io/spoke/
State of the Map tickets and program now accessible at https://2022.stateofthemap.org/programme/. #OpenStreetMap #SotM #SotM22
Let‚Äôs head to Papua New Guinea to meet Nicxon Piaso, #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/06/01/nicxon-piaso.html.
